 046:     """
 047:     Compute transition probabilities exp(q*t) for a 'stack' of q
 048:     matrices, over all values of t from a 1-d array, where q is selected
 049:     from the stack by indices in qi. Uses pre-allocated arrays for
 050:     intermediate calculations and output, to minimize overhead of
 051:     repeated calls (e.g. for ML optimization or MCMC).
 052:     Args:
 053:         q (double[m,k,k]): stack of m square rate matrices of dimension k
 054:         t (double[n]): 1-d array of times (branch lengths) of length n
 055:         qi (int[n]): 1-d array indicating assigning q matrices to times
 056:         p (double[n,k,k]): stack of n square p matrices holding results
 057:           of exponentiation, i.e., p[i] = exp(q[qi[i]]*t[i])
